title: Manufacturing Engineering
description: Manufacturing processes, production systems, facility design, and quality control in industrial engineering

questions.definition: Bonding of two materials using an adhesive material like glue or cement.
Mixture of a metal with one or more additional elements. Often a combination of two or more metals.
Process of changing materials to a liquid or plastic state and then shaping them in or around a mold.
Nonmetallic solids made from inorganic materials (often minerals). A very hard, inorganic, refractory, nonmetallic material with little electrical conductivity.
Joining of two materials through heat or pressure.
Process of joining parts through mechanical assembly and bonding.
Type of manufacturing process that produces the highest number of products at the highest quality and the lowest cost because plants are designed to produce a specific product.
System of ensuring the company is profitable by controlling the resources used in the manufacture of products, including materials, machine time, and labor.
Type of manufacturing process that is used to produce a single product or a small number of products, usually to meet a customer's particular need.
Act of cutting a circular hole down into the earth to extract water, natural gas, oil, and other materials from under the earth's surface.

Process concerned with the entire life of a product from the time the raw materials are gathered to the time the product's life is over and it is disposed of. Tries to minimize scrap, reduce or eliminate hazardous waste, and makes the most effective use of natural resources.

Design of production facilities specifically for the efficient production of products that will be made in them. Usually carried out by manufacturing engineers with expertise in tools, materials, processes, and the product(s) to be manufactured.
Type of tooling used to guide a work piece.
Chart used to record and communicate the order of the processes dictated by the manufacturing engineer to make each part.
Mechanical process used to change the shape of materials through compression, bending, or stretching.
Process of retrieving mature natural resources that grow on the earth. In manufacturing, this commonly refers to the cutting of trees for wood and wood products.
Type of manufacturing process that produces smaller batches of the same part.
Type of tooling used to guide tools to the correct location.

Delivery system that allows for the delivery of parts and materials at exactly the time they are needed in production. JIT delivery cuts down on the costs of maintaining a large inventory, but it is a much more complex system to manage.
Process of changing raw materials to make them more useful.
Design of machines, tools, and processes used to manufacture goods.
Movement of materials and products through a plant.
Chemical element that belongs to one of the families of metals on the periodic table; a type of inorganic material with good conductivity to heat and electricity.
Process used to extract materials like metals, coal, uranium, iron, diamonds, and stone from beneath the surface of the earth.
Type of chart used to study all operations in the manufacture of an entire product.
Way the operation name, machine, and tooling are recorded and communicated.

Arrangement of facilities based on the location of the materials that will be made into products and how they are moved through the plant, including such aspects as equipment layout, utility location, and traffic flow. It is also based on the economics of construction and operation, the specific requirements of the processes that will take place, the convenience of the maintenance that will be necessary, possible future expansion, and safety.
Processing of raw materials into standard stock.
Layout based on the location of the equipment depending on the process it performs.
Layout based on the entire facility being designed around the manufacture of one product. It is commonly used for continuous manufacturing.
System whereby manufacturers ensure the quality of their products meets or exceeds expectations.
Natural resources found in the earth, on the earth, and in the seas and made into industrial materials.
Processing of stock materials into useful products.
Decisions of what operations, or processes, will be used to create the product and in what order, or sequence, they will be performed.
Process of cutting materials to the desired size or shape through mechanical, heat, or chemical means.
Largest professional society for manufacturing engineers with over 500,000 members in more than 70 countries.
Type of plastic that can be easily reheated and reshaped with little or no damage to the plastic because there is little or no bonding between the chains.

Type of plastic that is generally stronger than thermoplastic because it is cured with heat and pressure to crosslink the chains. Once cured, it can no longer be reshaped and will remain rigid even when heat is applied.
